tit.e: Mt. Kongo (a mountain between Nara Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture)
Mt. Kongo (a mountain between Nara Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture)

sen.j: 金剛山（こんごうさん）は、奈良県御所市と大阪府南河内郡千早赤阪村との境目にある山。
sen.e: Kongo-san Mountain (Kongo-san) is a mountain located between Gose City, Nara Prefecture and Chihayaakasaka-mura, Minamikawachi District, Osaka Prefecture.
Mt. Kongo (also known as Kongo mountain range) is a mountain located between Gose City, Nara Prefecture and Chihaya Akasaka Village, Minamikawachi County, Osaka Prefecture.
Mt. Kongo (also known as Kongo mountain range) is a mountain located between Gose City, Nara Prefecture and Chihaya Akasaka Village, Minamikawachi County, Osaka Prefecture.
It is 1,125 meters high.
It is 1,125 meters high.
It is 1,125 meters high.

sen.j: 正確な山頂は御所市の葛木神社 (御所市)の本殿の裏山で立ち入ることはできない。
sen.e: The exact top of the mountain is located on the hill at the back of Honden (main shrine) of Katsuragi-jinja Shrine in Gose City and it is a forbidden zone.
The exact top of the mountain is located on the hill at the back of Honden (main shrine) of Katsuragi-jinja Shrine in Gose City and it is a forbidden zone.
sen.cmt: 原文には (御所市) とありますが、リンク先の単語が抽出されるバグのようですので、訳出しておりません。
sen.e: The exact top of the mountain is located on the hill at the back of Honden (main shrine) of Katsuragi-jinja Shrine in Gose City and it is a forbidden zone.

sen.j: 国見城跡の広場が山頂扱いされている。
sen.e: Therefore, the open field of the Kunimi Castle site is regarded as a mountaintop.
Therefore, the open field of the Kunimi-jo Castle site is regarded as a mountaintop.
Therefore, the open field of the Kunimi-jo Castle site is regarded as a mountaintop.

sen.j: 大阪府の最高峰であり、大阪府の最高地点 (1,056m) がこの山の中腹にある。
sen.e: It is the highest mountain peak in Osaka Prefecture, and the highest peak of Osaka Prefecture (1,056 meters) is located at the half way up of this mountain.
It is the highest mountain peak in Osaka Prefecture, and the highest peak of the prefecture (1,056 meters) is located at the half way up of this mountain.
It is the highest mountain peak in Osaka Prefecture, and the highest peak of the prefecture (1,056 meters) is located at the half way up of this mountain.

sen.j: 金剛生駒紀泉国定公園内に位置する。
sen.e: It is located within Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park.
It is located within Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park.
It is located within Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park.

sen.j: 日本有数の登山者数を誇り、その登山者数は富士山と争う程である。
sen.e: It boats the large number of climbers, which is one of the foremost in Japan, and the number of climbers is equivalent to that of Mt. Fuji.
It boasts the large number of climbers, which is one of the foremost in Japan, equivalent to that of Mt. Fuji.
sen.cmt: スペル修正し、表現を変えました。
sen.e: It boasts the large number of climbers, which is one of the foremost in Japan, equivalent to that of Mt. Fuji.

sen.j: 大阪府側山麓から山頂付近までを結ぶ金剛山ロープウェイは、日本で唯一の村営索道である。
sen.e: Mt. Kongo Ropeway which connects the point in the foot of a mountain (the base of a mountain) and the mountaintop, is the only cable way operated by a village in Japan.
Kongo-san Ropeway which connects the point in the foot of a mountain in Osaka Prefecture side and the mountaintop, is the only cable way operated by a village in Japan.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「大阪府側」を補足しました。
sen.e: Kongo-san Ropeway which connects the point in the foot of a mountain in Osaka Prefecture side and the mountaintop, is the only cable way operated by a village in Japan.

sen.j: 冬には樹氷が見られる事でも知られている。
sen.e: It is known for frost-covered trees which can be viewed in winter.
It is known for frost-covered trees which can be viewed in winter.
It is known for frost-covered trees which can be viewed in winter.

sen.j: 冬の寒さを利用して、山麓では江戸時代～昭和30年代まで高野豆腐の生産が盛んであった。
sen.e: From the Edo Period through until 1964, koyadofu (freeze-dried bean curd) was greatly produced along the foot of the mountain, taking advantage of the winter cold.
From the Edo period through until 1964, koyadofu (freeze-dried bean curd) was greatly produced along the foot of the mountain, taking advantage of the winter cold.
From the Edo period through until 1964, koyadofu (freeze-dried bean curd) was greatly produced along the foot of the mountain, taking advantage of the winter cold.

tit.e: Kongo-san Mountain and EN no Gyoja (A semi-legendary holy man noted for his practice of mountain asceticism during the second half of the 7 century)
Mt. Kongo and EN no Gyoja (A semi-legendary holy man noted for his practice of mountain asceticism during the second half of the seventh century)
Mt. Kongo and EN no Gyoja (A semi-legendary holy man noted for his practice of mountain asceticism during the second half of the seventh century)

sen.j: 金剛山は修験道の開祖、今から約1,300年前、16歳の時から、この山で修行し、全国各地の霊山へ駆け巡ったと伝えられる役行者（えんのぎょうじゃ）が修行した山として知られている。
sen.e: Kongo-san Mountain is known as a mountain where EN no Gyoja, the founder of mountain asceticism, who started practicing at the age of sixteen when it was 1,300 years ago, and visited sacred mountains across the country, practiced mountain asceticism.

Mt. Kongo is known as a mountain where EN no Gyoja, the founder of mountain asceticism, who started practicing at the age of 16 when it was 1,300 years ago, and visited sacred mountains across the country, practiced mountain asceticism.

Mt. Kongo is known as a mountain where EN no Gyoja, the founder of mountain asceticism, who started practicing at the age of 16 when it was 1,300 years ago, and visited sacred mountains across the country, practiced mountain asceticism.

sen.j: 山頂付近には役行者が開いたとされる転法輪寺 (御所市)（真言宗醍醐派、葛城修験道大本山）がある。
sen.e: In the vicinity of the mountaintop, there is Tenporin-ji Temple (Gose City) (Shingon sect Daigoha school, Grand Head Temple of Katsuragi Shugendo [Katsuragi Mountain Ascetic]).
In the vicinity of the mountaintop, there is Tenporin-ji Temple (Gose City) (Daigoha school of Shingonshu sect, Grand Head Temple of Katsuragi Shugendo [Katsuragi Mountain Ascetic]).
In the vicinity of the mountaintop, there is Tenporin-ji Temple (Gose City) (Daigoha school of Shingonshu sect, Grand Head Temple of Katsuragi Shugendo [Katsuragi Mountain Ascetic]).

sen.j: 近くには一言主を祭神とする葛木神社 (御所市)がある。
sen.e: Katsuragi-jinja Shrine (Gose City) where Hitokoto nushi (Japanese ancient god) as an enshrined deity is worshipped is nearby.
Katsuragi-jinja Shrine (Gose City) where Hitokoto nushi (Japanese ancient god) as an enshrined deity is worshipped is nearby.
Katsuragi-jinja Shrine (Gose City) where Hitokoto nushi (Japanese ancient god) as an enshrined deity is worshipped is nearby.

sen.j: 毎年7月7日の役行者のご命日には一言主ノ神を祀る葛木神社と法起菩薩を本尊とする転法輪寺との珍しい神仏習合のれんげ祭りが行われている。
sen.e: On the death anniversary of EN no Gyoja, on July 7in every year, Renge Matsuri (Lotus Flower Festival) was held by Tenporin-ji Temple, whose honzon (principal image of Buddha) is Hoki Bosatsu and by Katsuragi-jinja Shrine where Hitokotonushi no Okami is worshipped, which is syncretization of Shinto with Buddhismand is a rare case.

On July 7, the death anniversary of EN no Gyoja, in every year, Renge Matsuri (Lotus Flower Festival) was held by Tenporin-ji Temple, whose principal image is Hoki Bosatsu and by Katsuragi-jinja Shrine where Hitokotonushi no Okami is worshipped, which is syncretization of Shinto with Buddhism and is a rare case.

On July 7, the death anniversary of EN no Gyoja, in every year, Renge Matsuri (Lotus Flower Festival) was held by Tenporin-ji Temple, whose principal image is Hoki Bosatsu and by Katsuragi-jinja Shrine where Hitokotonushi no Okami is worshipped, which is syncretization of Shinto with Buddhism and is a rare case.

sen.j: 金剛山周辺には太平記の英雄楠木正成の城であった千早城、上赤坂城、下赤坂城の城跡や楠公誕生地など、正成ゆかりの史跡が点在している。
sen.e: In the vicinity of Kongo-san Mountain, historic sites that are associated with Masashige including Chihaya Castle which used to be the castle of Masashige KUSUNOKI, a hero of Taiheiki (The Record of the Great Peace), Kamiakasaka-jo Castle, sites of Shimoakasaka-jo Castle, the birth place of Nanko are scattered.

In the vicinity of Mt. Kongo, historic sites that are associated with Masashige including Chihaya-jo Castle which used to be the castle of Masashige KUSUNOKI, a hero of Taiheiki (The Record of the Great Peace), Kamiakasaka-jo Castle, sites of Shimoakasaka-jo Castle, and his birth place are scattered.

In the vicinity of Mt. Kongo, historic sites that are associated with Masashige including Chihaya-jo Castle which used to be the castle of Masashige KUSUNOKI, a hero of Taiheiki (The Record of the Great Peace), Kamiakasaka-jo Castle, sites of Shimoakasaka-jo Castle, and his birth place are scattered.

sen.j: 楠木正成の菩提寺であった観心寺には、正成が少年期を観心寺で過ごした記録が残っている。
sen.e: In Kanshin-ji Temple which was a family temple of Masashige KUSUNOKI, there is a record that shows that Masashige spent his boyhood at Kanshin-ji Temple.
In Kanshin-ji Temple which was a family temple of Masashige KUSUNOKI, there is a record that shows that Masashige spent his boyhood at Kanshin-ji Temple.
In Kanshin-ji Temple which was a family temple of Masashige KUSUNOKI, there is a record that shows that Masashige spent his boyhood at Kanshin-ji Temple.

tit.e: The number of climbing Kongo-san Mountain.
The number of climbing Mt. Kongo
The number of climbing Mt. Kongo

sen.j: 現在の金剛山には、他の山ではあまりみられない珍しい登山回数の記録システムがある。
sen.e: Today, Kongo-san Mountain has a recording system of the number of climbing the mountain, which is rarely used in other mountains.
Today, Mt. Kongo has a recording system of the number of climbing the mountain, which is rarely used in other mountains.
Today, Mt. Kongo has a recording system of the number of climbing the mountain, which is rarely used in other mountains.

sen.j: 会員になれば登山毎に山頂で回数スタンプを捺印してもらえる。
sen.e: If you become a member, you get stamps which indicate the number of climbing on the mountaintop each time you climb the mountain.
If you become a member, you get stamps which indicate the number of climbing on the mountaintop each time you climb the mountain.
If you become a member, you get stamps which indicate the number of climbing on the mountaintop each time you climb the mountain.

sen.j: 登山回数100回以上の登山者には毎年5月3日に表彰式が行われる。
sen.e: Climbers who climbed over 100 times are awarded on May 3 in every year.
Climbers who climbed over 100 times are awarded on May 3 in every year.
Climbers who climbed over 100 times are awarded on May 3 in every year.

sen.j: 現在で最高記録者は1万回の金剛登山回数が記録されている。
sen.e: So far, the climber who climbed 10,000 times is the person who has the best record.
So far, the climber who climbed 10,000 times is the person who has the best record.
So far, the climber who climbed 10,000 times is the person who has the best record.

sen.j: 毎日登山しても25年以上の年月が必要となる計算である。
sen.e: Even you climb the mountain everyday, over 25 years are required to achieve 10,000 times.
Even you climb the mountain every day, over 25 years are required to achieve 10,000 times.
Even you climb the mountain every day, over 25 years are required to achieve 10,000 times.

sen.j: 以前は一日に複数回捺印してもらえたが、現在は一日一回である。
sen.e: In the past, you got several stamps in a day, and currently, you can get one stamp in a day.
In the past, you got several stamps in a day, and currently, you can get one stamp in a day.
In the past, you got several stamps in a day, and currently, you can get one stamp in a day.

sen.j: 大阪市内からでも車で60分程度の距離にある為、健康登山、回数登山の山としても有名。
sen.e: Since it is 60 minute-car ride from the Osaka City, it is known as a mountain for health and for counting the number of climbing.
Since it is 60 minute-car ride from the Osaka City, it is known as a mountain for health and for counting the number of climbing.
Since it is 60 minute-car ride from the Osaka City, it is known as a mountain for health and for counting the number of climbing.

sen.j: 朝の出勤前や、夕方仕事が終わってから毎日登山に来る人も数多い。
sen.e: A number of people visit and climb the mountain before and after work.
A number of people visit and climb the mountain everyday before work in the morning and after work in the evening.
A number of people visit and climb the mountain everyday before work in the morning and after work in the evening.

tit.j: 金剛山を舞台とした作品

sen.j: 宇宙皇子（うつのみこ） - 藤川桂介原作の小説
sen.e: Utsunomiko, The novel of Keisuke FUJIKAWA
Utsunomiko: The novel originally written by Keisuke FUJIKAWA
sen.cmt: コロンを使用し、表現を変えました。
sen.e: Utsunomiko: The novel originally written by Keisuke FUJIKAWA

sen.j: 国見城跡（山頂の広場）からは大阪湾が一望できる。
sen.e: The site of Kunimi Castle (the open field of the mountaintop) has a view of Osaka Bay.
The site of Kunimi-jo Castle (the open field of the mountaintop) has a view of Osaka-wan Bay.
The site of Kunimi-jo Castle (the open field of the mountaintop) has a view of Osaka-wan Bay.

sen.j: 天気がよければ明石海峡大橋がはっきり見える事もある。
sen.e: Weather permitting, Akashi-Kaikyo Bridge may be clearly viewed.
As weather permits, Akashi-Kaikyo Ohashi Bridge may be clearly viewed.
As weather permits, Akashi-Kaikyo Ohashi Bridge may be clearly viewed.

sen.j: 展望台からは、大阪府側は関西国際空港や、その向こうの淡路島も見える事がある。
sen.e: At the viewing platform, Kansai International Airport and Awaji-shima Island beyond the Kansai International Airport on the Osaka Prefecture side could be clearly viewed.
At the viewing platform, Kansai International Airport, followed by Awaji-shima Island on the Osaka Prefecture side could be clearly viewed.
At the viewing platform, Kansai International Airport, followed by Awaji-shima Island on the Osaka Prefecture side could be clearly viewed.

sen.j: 奈良県側は奈良盆地、その向こうの大峰山を望む。
sen.e: Nara Basin and Mt. Omine beyond the Nara Basin on the Nara Prefecture side can be viewed.
Nara Basin, followed by Mt. Omine, on the Nara Prefecture side can be viewed.
Nara Basin, followed by Mt. Omine, on the Nara Prefecture side can be viewed.

sen.j: 近鉄長野線 富田林駅から金剛自動車千早線
sen.e: Take Chihaya Route of Kongo motor Co., Ltd. at the Tondabayashi Station of Kintetsu Nagano Line.
Take Chihaya Line of Kongo motor Co., Ltd. at the Tondabayashi Station of Kintetsu Nagano Line.
Take Chihaya Line of Kongo motor Co., Ltd. at the Tondabayashi Station of Kintetsu Nagano Line.

sen.j: 「千早ロープウェイ前行き」に乗車し、「金剛登山口」バス停または終点「千早ロープウェイ前」バス停下車。
sen.e: Get on the bus, `Chihaya Ropeway-bound' and get off the bus at `the starting point to Kongo-san Mountain ascent' or at the last stop, `Chihaya Ropeway.'
Get on the bus, 'Chihaya Ropeway-mae bound' and get off at 'Kongo Tozanguchi' (the starting point to Kongo-san Mountain ascent) bus stop or at the last stop, 'Chihaya Ropeway mae.'
Get on the bus, 'Chihaya Ropeway-mae bound' and get off at 'Kongo Tozanguchi' (the starting point to Kongo-san Mountain ascent) bus stop or at the last stop, 'Chihaya Ropeway mae.'

sen.j: 「金剛登山口行き」に乗車し、終点「金剛登山口」バス停下車。
sen.e: Get on the bus, `the starting point to Kongo-san Mountain ascent-bound,' and get off at the last stop, `the starting point to Kongo-san Mountain ascent.'
Get on the bus, 'Kongo Tozanguchi bound,' and get off at the last stop, 'Kongo Tozanguchi.'
Get on the bus, 'Kongo Tozanguchi bound,' and get off at the last stop, 'Kongo Tozanguchi.'

sen.j: 南海高野線および近鉄長野線 河内長野駅から南海バス小深線「金剛山ロープウェイ前行き（8、11系統）」に乗車し、「金剛登山口」バス停または終点「金剛山ロープウェイ前」バス停下車。
sen.e: Get on the bus on Kobuka Route of Nankai Bus Co.,Ltd., `Mt. Kongo Ropeway-bound' (8,11) at Kawachinagano Station of Nankai-Koya Line or Kintetsu Nagano Line, and get off the bus at `the starting point to Kongo-san Mountain ascent' or at the last stop, `Kongo-san Mountain Ropeway.'

From Kawachinagano Station of Nankai-Koya Line or Kintetsu Nagano Line, take the bus on Kobuka Route of Nankai Bus Co., Ltd., 'Kongosan Ropeway mae bound' (8 or 11 system), and get off at 'Kongo Tozanguchi' bus stop or at the last stop, 'Kongosan Ropeway mae.'

From Kawachinagano Station of Nankai-Koya Line or Kintetsu Nagano Line, take the bus on Kobuka Route of Nankai Bus Co., Ltd., 'Kongosan Ropeway mae bound' (8 or 11 system), and get off at 'Kongo Tozanguchi' bus stop or at the last stop, 'Kongosan Ropeway mae.'
